alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Powder River; Southern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:35PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn, western Powder River and southern Rosebud Counties through 1115 PM MDT... At 1035 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles southeast of Busby, or 39 miles south of Colstrip, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lame Deer, Ashland, Busby, Birney, Otter, Kirby, Muddy Cluster, Rosebud Battlefield Park, Birney Village and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Powder River; Southern Rosebud
